Text: Nice time at @ChazaqOrg's legislative dinner. Discussed several issues of importance to the Jewish community including my work to combat the spike in anti-Semitism & increasing funding for @DHSgov's Nonprofit Security Grant Program to improve safety for synagogues & nonprofits. https://t.co/k2StBo9Eil

Access to affordable broadband has been an issue I have been championing for years. Parent’s need quality internet access for work and kids need it for school. If you think you are eligible to receive affordable broadband support, please visit https://t.co/az4cspaw8H.

Thanks to the following organizations for supporting this important bipartisan bill: @autismspeaks, @FamilyVoices, @NCSAutismOrg, @AutismSociety, @TheArcUS, @NACDD and the American Academy of Pediatrics and National Down Syndrome Society. 2/2
https://t.co/c2ulSUB2lh

Today, on National Caregivers Day, I introduced the Autism Family Caregivers Act alongside @RepBrianFitz & @USRepMikeDoyle. This bill would provide skills training to caregivers taking care of children w/ autism spectrum disorder or other developmental disabilities or delays. 1/2

Following a rise in hate crimes & hostage standoff at the synagogue in #Colleyville, Texas, it is imperative that houses of worship & nonprofits can ensure the safety & security of their properties. Thanks to @JCRCNY, @NYSDHSES, @NYPDnews & @QnsBPRichards for participating. 2/2

Thanks to all who logged on to my annual workshop about the Nonprofit Security Grant Program, which provides houses of worship & nonprofits with funds to guard against threats & attacks. The event provided details about the program & how to apply for funding. 1/2 https://t.co/VRe6RqweCg

We are one step closer toward creating a national museum dedicated to AAPI history and culture. The journey will be long but we are moving toward a physical location that commemorates the contributions of the AAPI community. #AAPImuseum (2/2)

Today, my bipartisan bill, to establish a commission to create a national #AAPImuseum dedicated to preserving the history and culture of #AAPIs was reported out of committee. (1/2) https://t.co/CHcVQHUW1K

Thank you @JDBalartMSNBC for inviting me to talk about these senseless attacks on the AAPI community in NYC and across the nation. They must stop. Addressing issues like homelessness and mental health struggles is one of many steps needed to keep our communities safe. https://t.co/swii7hCLjQ

Free at-home #COVID19 test kits are now available for pick up at several libraries and cultural institutions throughout New York City. Please see the flyer below for the list of facilities in #Queens. https://t.co/rQOoj1RBFh

Working w/ colleagues in demanding answers about the spike in @ConEdison rates. We’re asking @NYSDPS to investigate the increases that our constituents are seeing on electric bills. NYers deserve affordable rates, especially as many continue struggling from the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/iEXQqaW3of
Standing with @AndrewHevesi, @SenJoeAddabbo and @Lynn4NYC in denouncing anti-Semitic graffiti found in #ForestHills. We will not tolerate this hate! https://t.co/qwb9mwgj8j
This is the outcome for which we were fighting. Great to work on this with @RepYvetteClarke and @RepRitchie. https://t.co/CmzwFFRTTQ
Look forward to working together to help close the digital divide. Thank you @SenatorParker, @LeroyComrie, @SenatorHinchey, @SenSeanRyan, @AmyPaulin, @nily, @PamelaHunter128 and @PatBurke142. 2/2

Great to bring together #NYS lawmakers and @JRosenworcel for a discussion about our efforts to increase and improve access to the #internet. Proud to have championed the effort in Congress, especially during #COVID19. 1/2 https://t.co/rX54xNlspc

On Friday, I joined colleagues and community leaders in condemning the attack on a South #Korean diplomat who was assaulted in Manhattan. 2/2 
https://t.co/Uich2G3f3M https://t.co/w5bXiwAUc4

Yet again, we are denouncing another unprovoked attack on an innocent bystander of #Asian descent. Horrified by this latest brutal and senseless incident. All New Yorkers deserve to feel safe! Praying for the victim’s family at this difficult time. 1/2 https://t.co/llbycUqvwh

Congressional staff work relentlessly to help serve our constituents & our country. They deserve the protections & benefits that come with unionization. I am proud to be an original cosponsor of @RepAndyLevin’s resolution recognizing Congressional workers' right to organize. https://t.co/BiDNOXqS6X

We will not tolerate union busting in NYC! Proud to stand with @Starbucks employees seeking to unionize. Unions are the backbone of our workforce. Will help build a better future for workers and New York. https://t.co/zaeddqCmyL https://t.co/8y0HADz44O

There is no more time to waste. The Senate needs to include a pathway to citizenship in the #BuildBackBetter Act, and pass the bill. Must ensure citizenship and permanent protections for immigrant families in NY who have long called America home. #Citizenship4All https://t.co/GWzMJzmqNd

NY’s Homeowner Assistance Fund - the federally funded program I helped pass for homeowners at risk of default, foreclosure or displacement due to #COVID19 - will stop accepting new applications on Friday, February 18. Impacted homeowners should apply ASAP. https://t.co/Ks1l3qnOS0

As Kids' Safety Caucus Co-Chair, I'm joining @RepSusanWild in seeking a simple, yet potentially lifesaving action from @YouTube: take down "How To Tie a Noose" videos. At a time when adolescent suicide rates are on the rise, taking this step could save lives. #SaferInternetDay https://t.co/WbWKBlnJNI

.@NYCHealthSystem has announced this week’s list of #COVID19 testing sites in #Queens. Tests continue to be free and rapid and PCR tests are offered. Please check each location for details such as operating hours, ages served and tests provided. https://t.co/8bwO1xV5F0

On the Capitol steps w/ colleagues tonight standing for a moment of silence in honor of the more than 900k people who have died due to #COVID19. This pandemic has taken a major toll on our nation, but as we begin to emerge from it, we cannot forget those we have lost. https://t.co/1vVqH1Wza5

Great speaking at the celebration of the 73rd Republic Day of #India held recently by the Hindu Temple Society of North America in #Flushing. The event also remembered leaders of non-violence. https://t.co/KdbCXlWjcD
Also great to take part in Eagle Scout Court of Honor ceremony held by Boy Scout Troop 96 based in #ForestHills. #Queens 2/2 https://t.co/CqfWSpr7gV
Nice time at St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church for Eagle Scout Court of Honor ceremony held by Boy Scout Troop 268 in #Flushing. 1/2 https://t.co/CX0iJQ93Hu

Thanks to @POTUS for establishing an Advisory Commission on Asian Americans, Native Hawaiians & Pacific Islanders. Congrats to its members who were sworn in yesterday. Looking forward to working together on behalf of the #AAPI community. https://t.co/WE4TyNUozB https://t.co/45oSMeOZjw

People in #Queens use the MTA everyday to go to work, school and see loved ones, just like millions of New Yorkers across the city. That is why on #TransitEquityDay, it is important to strive toward transportation that is accessible, affordable and reliable for all New Yorkers.
Congressional staff, like all workers, deserve the right to unionize. These professionals work nonstop to serve constituents and our country, and I support their rights in the workplace.

Honored to attend last night’s vigil in #ForestHills to remember Detectives Mora & Rivera. They sacrificed their lives to protect NYers & our city will never forget them. Please keep their families in your thoughts at this difficult time. Thank you @NYPD112Pct & @112thpctcouncil. https://t.co/b6cJ9N2R96

We must crack down on gun trafficking, invest in community groups and gun violence prevention, and make sure we have all the tools and resources we need to combat crime and stop guns from coming into NYC and other areas throughout the nation. 2/2 https://t.co/CBcv3iHqSy

Grateful to join @POTUS, @NYCMayor & @GovKathyHochul at One Police Plaza to address #gunviolence. This issue touches all cities across the country & has hit our city hard recently. Support from all branches of government is crucial to keep New Yorkers safe in our communities. 1/2 https://t.co/yML3NPiu5i

.@NYSConsumer has warned NYers to be aware of coronavirus testing #scams related to the federal government’s new #COVID19 test ordering program. Please be on the alert & know that the only website for the free at-home test kits is https://t.co/TUd1UEfbMJ. https://t.co/0LJE5ajwUY

The recent bomb threats against historically Black colleges and universities is deeply concerning and I condemn these unconscionable acts. Those responsible must be held accountable. All students deserve to learn in a safe and secure environment.

Joining the #ForestHills Asian Association for its recent day of remembrance and action where we remembered victims of anti-Asian hate and underscored our continuing fight to combat this ongoing xenophobia and violence. https://t.co/913xi8Rm2c

Below is this week’s list of #COVID19 testing sites in #Queens. Tests are free and rapid and PCR tests are offered. Please check each location for days and hours of operation, ages served, and types of tests available. https://t.co/uoRasJ9Kfa

Proud to mark #BlackHistoryMonth which is a celebration of Black Americans & their contributions to our country. In February, we honor what Black Americans have fought for & accomplished, while also understanding that there is still work to be done in advancing equality for all.
Happy #LunarNewYear! Please join me in ringing in the Year of the Tiger. I wish you all a healthy, happy, and prosperous New Year. https://t.co/BiftunvLLT

Announced today that I’ve introduced a new bill that would make #LunarNewYear a federal holiday. Every year, millions of #Asian Americans celebrate and recognize this important holiday, and it’s time for their government to do the same. https://t.co/4UCp9VF1Nl

Proud that NYC implemented my bill to create a school holiday for #LunarNewYear in #NYC. Schools will be closed Tuesday so families can be together. Looking forward to this year’s celebration. Joined then-Mayor de Blasio in 2015 to make the announcement: https://t.co/YBNywKt7Q8

A winter storm warning and hazardous travel advisory are in effect for #Queens and the rest of NYC. Please take needed precautions and be safe during the snow and frigid temperatures. https://t.co/1OXBJ28tvf

Congratulations to cheerleaders from @StFrancisPrep1 in #FreshMeadows who will be heading to the National High School Cheerleading Championship. Wishing them all the best in the competition. #Queens 
https://t.co/FJ4euD1Klw

Thank you to the Alliance for Peacebuilding for highlighting my work to include #youth in international #PeaceBuilding, and my championing of the Youth, Peace and Security Act. https://t.co/GwIu4fgGA5

On International Holocaust Remembrance Day, we honor the millions who were murdered during the Holocaust & renew our commitment to combat anti-Semitism whenever & wherever it rears its ugly head. Must stay united in our fight & I will continue doing all I can to combat this hate.

The 2022 tax filing season began this week and runs through April 18. Much for taxpayers to know about including claiming the Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC), Child Tax Credit (CTC) and other refundable credits. Helpful info and tips from @WaysMeansCmte: https://t.co/qogLX8BSzC.

Joining House and Senate colleagues in asking President Biden to deliver on his promise to #CancelStudentDebt. Would strengthen our economy, help close the racial wealth gap & give borrowers the best chance at recovering from the #COVID pandemic. Time to act is now. https://t.co/tFfvyZoLjD

I condemn the unacceptable and hate-filled threats made against @StFrancisPrep1. Been in touch with the school & the @NYPD107Pct. Must do everything possible to keep students safe. Must be the top priority. https://t.co/OkAkLrRYF1 @BrooklynDiocese

Devastated by this news. Asking NYers to keep Officer Mora's loved ones in their prayers as our city mourns his death. He & Officer Rivera were heroes who dedicated themselves to keeping us safe & they will never be forgotten. Must do everything possible to combat gun violence. https://t.co/PtNcSAvBwu
Delivering more #COVID19 test kits to constituents throughout my district over the weekend and this past week. #Queens https://t.co/Y19Q5El4nX https://t.co/AQjQwLZqO2

Following the hostage standoff at Congregation Beth Israel in #Colleyville, Texas, I’m renewing my commitment to seek additional funding for the Nonprofit Security Grant Program, which provides funds for security at houses of worship and nonprofits. https://t.co/ZbKaVgtvRD

Troubled over hearing the final #BuildBackBetter Act package may cut critical programs like money for housing. Would be unacceptable & negatively impact all public housing authorities including #NYCHA. We need strong investment in public housing, not less. https://t.co/CxBhwYYsZG

Calling on the head of the #IRS to reduce the large backlog of #tax returns. The delays, which also include unemployment, Child Tax Credit & stimulus payments, have impacted millions including #Queens residents. https://t.co/rz0m6KGxUg

this almost five decades old ruling is upheld across the nation. The Senate must pass the Women’s Health Protection Act which would protect a woman’s right to choose. We have no more time to waste. A women’s right to independence over her own body is at stake. #PassWHPA 2/2

As we approach almost a half century since #SCOTUS' 7-2 ruling on Roe v. Wade, abortion rights are under serious threat. It is very possible that our nation could see a woman’s right to choose almost completely abolished. Right now, we must do all we can to make sure... 1/2

Great to join @IBEW’s Electrical Workers Minority Caucus at its annual leadership conference to discuss diversity in the labor force, voting rights and my efforts to promote the histories of communities of color. Always proud to stand with the men and women of labor. https://t.co/yqtzlwJptb

Great to see New Jersey now requiring #Asian American history to be taught in public schools. As I’ve said, our students must be taught ALL of America’s history & I will continue pushing my legislation to promote this effort on the federal level. https://t.co/8CSvllKKTD
The new federal government website to order free at-home #COVID19 test kits is officially up and running. Go to https://t.co/TUd1UEfbMJ to submit your request.

On #MLKDay, we commemorate the life of Dr. Martin Luther King and honor the remarkable legacy he left behind. We must continue fighting the assault on voting rights and do all we can to enact legislation that ensures each and every American equal access to the ballot box.

Glad that the hostages in #Colleyville, TX have been released & are safe. Continuing to monitor the situation & learn more details. Nobody should ever fear violence when gathering at houses of worship. My office has been in touch w/ NYPD about ensuring safety at local synagogues.

My heart aches for the victim’s loved ones. This incident highlights the need to ensure that all New Yorkers who use mass transit are safe and that those in need of mental health services receive the help they require. My full statement: https://t.co/BtiOqLCNzT. 2/2

Horrified over the death of an #Asian woman who was killed when she was pushed onto the tracks at the Times Square subway station. Condemning this senseless act of violence at the scene with @NYCMayor, @NYPDPC & others. https://t.co/3EXDeivtIN 1/2

Delivering #COVID19 test kits to the homes of constituents this afternoon. Continues to be challenging for a number of people in my district to access testing including the elderly & disabled. Keeping up the fight to ensure that our communities can secure needed testing. #Queens https://t.co/U77PfJIgtU

Proud to help pass #FreedomToVote–#JohnLewisVotingRightsAct in the House today. #VotingRights are under attack in our country. The Senate must now act and do whatever it takes to ensure that we are protecting the fundamental right to vote for all Americans. #FightForVotingRights

I, @RepBowman & members of our #NY delegation are asking the President for help in fighting #NYC’s latest #COVID19 surge. We requested free rapid test kits, additional guidance for schools & ensuring that test kits are accompanied with translations. https://t.co/GJWkhRsy81
Letters and documentation can be mailed to: FEMA National Processing Service Center, P.O. Box 10055, Hyattsville, MD 20782-8055. https://t.co/xrucGOSVGa 2/2

The application period to seek assistance for Hurricane Ida damage ended Jan. 4. But there is a 60-day grace period to submit a late application. Applicants must send a signed letter to @fema explaining the extenuating circumstances that prevented them from applying. 1/2
#COVID19 testing sites this week in #Queens. https://t.co/XiAjSS29tT
Bitterly cold weather conditions today in #Queens and the rest of New York City. Please be sure to take appropriate precautions to stay safe. https://t.co/1am4Uil9z4

Joining @RepAdamSchiff, @SenSanders, @RepRoKhanna and more than 40 members of the House and Senate in calling on the administration to build on current efforts to expand access #COVID19 testing. https://t.co/Ff3KJHNGMR
I'm partnering with @JeniferRajkumar and several other colleagues to ensure the distribution of at-home #COVID19 test kits on Tuesday. https://t.co/TAITbXIIDC
Pleased to help bring free #COVID19 testing to #Elmhurst this Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. https://t.co/kAnCbZQ3uf

Horrible tragedy in the #Bronx. Devastated over this terrible loss of life. Praying for the families of the victims and those who have been injured. We thank our first responders for rushing to the scene and stand with all who have been impacted. 
https://t.co/DgBwsUOIo0

Following multiple inquiries with @USPS, I’m pleased to announce that the #Elmhurst A Post Office has reopened. Glad the facility can get back to serving the community and thankful to all who helped repair the damages caused by Hurricane Ida. https://t.co/ttT11uftGQ

Thanks to @GovKathyHochul for announcing her initiative “Promote Anti-Hate, Racial Equity, & Justice for All NYers." The plan would add protections for domestic violence victims & immigrants, establish a hate & bias prevention unit, & expand benefits for victims of hate crimes.

Denouncing last year's heinous attack on our democracy with @CommonCauseNY and other local groups during virtual #January6 vigil last night in #NYC. We must combat any effort to overturn free and fair elections and pass the Freedom to Vote Act. Our democracy is worth protecting. https://t.co/uG1rbXiR1d

Pleased that #COVID19 testing is now available in #ForestHills after I called for more testing sites in my district. Walk-in appointments are available Mon to Sun, 7 am to 6 pm at MacDonald Park. Thanks to @NorthwellHealth & @QnsBPRichards for working to establish this location.
Wishing a very happy and joyous #ThreeKingsDay to all who are celebrating today.

The #January6th insurrection was an assault on our democracy. I was barricaded in a room off the House floor fearing for my life as the angry mob marched right outside my door. My full statement below as we mark the one-year anniversary of the riots. https://t.co/Rm7gfYJULL

#ICYMI: Applications are now being accepted for the #NY State Homeowner Assistance Fund. It provides $539 million for eligible homeowners who are at risk of default, foreclosure, or displacement due to financial hardship caused by #COVID19. Apply here: https://t.co/QskoXYCUGL

While more #COVID19 testing sites continue to open in #Queens, some areas in my district still don’t have any. Middle Village, Maspeth, Forest Hills, Glendale and Ridgewood need testing sites. I am working with local colleagues to make sure this happens. https://t.co/gk6tEXCeSm

If you rent or own property that was damaged due to Hurricane Ida in Sept., then you may be eligible for compensation under the Federal Disaster Assistance program. To apply for FEMA assistance, visit https://t.co/CJZjAI1X0L. (2/2)
ICYMI! Tmrw, Jan. 4, is the deadline to apply for Federal Disaster Assistance for damage caused by Hurricane Ida. (1/2)

From COVID-19, devastating flooding & ongoing hate crimes, 2021 was a challenging year for our communities. But I’m hopeful better days are ahead & that we continue to persist through the difficulties we face. As we ring in the #NewYear, I wish you a happy, healthy & safe 2022.

We need to keep our students and our educators protected as they return to school on Jan. 3. That is why I led a letter with New York Members of Congress requesting that City Hall distribute #COVID19 rapid test kits by Jan. 2 to NY public schools.
#ICYMI: Check out @scottwongDC's story on why I am leading the effort to create the first national museum of Asian American and Pacific Islander history and culture. https://t.co/DTbrk0gomc
#PSA: Check out information on #COVID19 testing sites in #Queens for 12/27/2021 - 1/02/2022. Please note all sites will be closed on Saturday, January 1. https://t.co/dik3rx8Wv0
Happy #Kwanzaa to everybody celebrating. I wish you and your loved ones over the next seven days a very joyous, prosperous and safe holiday.
Wishing a very Merry #Christmas to all who observe the holiday. Hoping you and your family have an enjoyable, healthy and safe celebration.

SNAP shouldn’t exclude a hot meal like rotisserie chicken, that is why I am excited to introduce the SNAP PLUS Act alongside @RepBobbyRush & @RepBrianFitz. This bill would provide a better range of dietary choices for families with limited access to hot meals. https://t.co/VUznCSHzBo

I commend @POTUS for moving quickly & efficiently to help battle #Omicron. His new plan of action aims to help the nation stay safe during holidays. I'm also in close contact w/ City & State leaders to ensure #Queens is equipped w/ additional resources to handle #COVID19. https://t.co/qEg3tZEFvr

Thank you @POTUS for your leadership to combat #COVID19 and the new #Omicron variant. It is imperative that #NYC get the necessary testing kits as cases continue to rise. Proud to lead a letter with @RepBowman and @RepEspaillat calling for this.
https://t.co/LTeQYXAO0c
Our borough requires funding to address the necessities of our local infrastructure and we need to receive our fair share. https://t.co/o0Kic8FHzw 2/2 https://t.co/KkYeZNJ4o8

The recently enacted #infrastructure bill will be a boon for NY. Proud to have helped pass it. But funding must make its way to #Queens including my district. Today, I joined @QnsBPRichards in calling on the city & state to ensure that this happens. 1/2 https://t.co/Um0XYLIhda

.@Sen_JoeManchin’s announcement today on #BuildBackBetterAct is devastating, esp. for moms & families  who were looking forward to new initiatives like affordable child care & universal pre-K. Mr. Manchin needs to do an about-face & pass the bill; families are counting on us. https://t.co/BaJhlJQASG

Pleased to announce that $28.4 million from the recently enacted #infrastructure bill is heading to #LaGuardiaAirport. Will go a long way towards needed improvements and jobs for New Yorkers. Proud to have helped pass the infrastructure bill in Congress. https://t.co/1USnsv50wa

Receiving my #COVID19 booster in #Bayside. Like the first two doses of the vaccine, it was quick, easy and painless. Everybody must continue to do their part and get their shots to help us get through the pandemic. https://t.co/p9cTlwLTnO

As @POTUS & @VP put forward a plan to replace #LeadPipes & service lines, I’m calling for the process to begin in #NY. We need an inventory of all lead service lines in the state to ensure the replacement of pipes & in turn access to clean drinking water. https://t.co/oE3FahXjt3
Congrats to @NYCFC for winning the #MLSCup! Proud of the entire team for this great and historic victory. https://t.co/bfv0nmAsbo

#Flushing is a bustling, vibrant & flourishing community. But nearly two years ago, much of its growth came to a halt when COVID-19 hit NY. Signs of a strong recovery & job growth are encouraging but we must make sure that we build back stronger to get the area back on its feet. https://t.co/JeROTb8h7g
Hearing from parents about rumors that NYC public schools are preparing to go remote again. Checked with City Hall and we're told that there is no imminent plan to move to remote learning.
I’m pleading with the @StateDept to bring a constituent back home with his wife and 5-year-old son after they all left #Afghanistan. #Queens #FreshMeadows https://t.co/ZuBMjQIv6a

Nice time seeing friends from civic and community groups across our borough at the #Queens Civic Congress’ Legislative Reception this past week. Thank you for continuing the work you do to improve our borough. https://t.co/LboytCFoWh

Today’s #SCOTUS decision is a missed opportunity to protect a woman’s right to choose. While it gives a route for abortion providers to pursue a federal lawsuit challenging the #TX law, abortion is still illegal in the state. This is unacceptable and we must protect this right.

As they begin their new lives here in the US, we must ensure they have the support they need to thrive, and that we continue to support and work to evacuate those women who continue to be at risk in Afghanistan. We must ensure human rights are protected for all.

Yesterday, I had the opportunity to listen to the powerful stories of six Afghan women who courageously paved the path forward for women in #Afghanistan. Women whose relatives fought alongside American soldiers during the almost 20 year war. 2/3
Today on #HumanRightsDay we are once again reminded that everyone is entitled to basic and universal human rights. 1/3

Recently, I worked with @RepYvetteClarke and @RepRitchie to urge @SecBlinken to rescind the costly “Passport Rule” from the Diversity Visa Program. This requirement prevents thousands of potential #NewAmericans from immigrating to our country.

Testified alongside @lisaling & @RussellJeung in support of my bill to create the 1st national museum dedicated to #AAPI history & culture. Thanks @NRDems for holding this important hearing.

I condemn these attacks. Reached out to Robert A. Van Wyck Junior High School. Our schools must ensure that our students are safe. Must be the number one priority. #Briarwood https://t.co/emwEINblwD

Celebrating the holiday season at the #Bayside Hills Holiday Lighting Festival held by the Bayside Hills Civic Association. #Queens https://t.co/58U73lcnqW

Paid leave allows people to spend time and bond with their newborns, care for a sick child or family member or recover from an illness, all without worrying about their paycheck. The U.S. is the only industrialized country without it. Way past time for that to change! 2/3 https://t.co/xblXaKMV3w

#PaidLeave must stay in the #BuildBackBetter Act! Joining @reshmasaujani–#MarshallPlanForMoms, @PaidLeaveUS and other advocates in NYC to underscore the importance of this crucial provision remaining in the bill. The short term spending bill is only a temporary solution. The middle class & all communities will suffer w/out annual gov’t funding.
